description: From what I can tell, there is not a way to open this in full screen. There does not seem to be any way to set options. I am going to get rid of this and try to get the file from the Ubuntu repo.

This is an amazing drawing tool hampered by a critical flaw. The end user cannot configure the application on the fly. Even resizing the window must be done via an external tool, and only via predetermined window sizes. So, open Tux paint, realize window is too small. Quit App, Open config tool, set window size to 1920x1080... apply, reboot app, realize window size is still a hair too small, go into app and realize the next size up is too large... live with it.
fatal flaw, no window sizing. Besides that? I'm fifteen and just had the time of my life drawing with sound effects. Holy cow. who knew.
I think children will like that, even the grown ones.

I'm 17, and I used to paint on this program really often at least a decade ago. I'll always remember the funny stories and scenes I made with this or the stuff I drew for my parents, I'm so glad it still looks the same...
